item.description:
@Envion wrote:

Dragon99999:

It’s fixed, I just didn’t have the ‘int’ in front of DistanceTo, thanks anyway blitz.

In other words (like the compiler said), “return type required.”

item.title: Help with coding? Should be easy
item.dc:creator: @x_blitz_x x blitz x
item.description:
@x_blitz_x wrote:

[quote=“Owner A Raffo, post:4, topic:300790”]d
^

means something wrong with the d, tryed a Capital D?[/quote]
Please… no.

I’m just going to explain your error. Each method must have a return type.

Because your method returned a type of integer, that must be before the method name

myMethod(int i) {
    return i;
}

As you can see it returns i, and i is an integer. So this must be declared before the method name.

int myMethod(int i) {
    return i;
}

Read full topic
item.source: Help with coding? Should be easy

item.title: Help with coding? Should be easy
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

@Owner A Raffo - wtf?

Try this:

int distanceTo(Player other) {
    return (int) Math.sqrt(Math.pow(absX - other.absX, 2) + Math.pow(absY - other.absY, 2));
}

You didn’t declare the method.

item.title: Help with coding? Should be easy
item.dc:creator: @Dragon99999 Dragon99999
item.description:
@Dragon99999 wrote:

Hey anyone,

I am trying to compile my server (built on TestScape) and I noticed that every time I did I get 1 error:

client.java:66: invalid method declaration; return type required
                    distanceTo(Player other) {
                    ^

When I go into my client.java and run a find I get this:

public int healingTimer = 0;

 	distanceTo(Player other) {
        return (int) Math.sqrt(Math.pow(absX - other.absX, 2) + Math.pow(absY - other.absY, 2));
    }

I am new to coding and I don’t know what to do. Can anyone help me with this?
So far I have tried:

  1. Removing the int. >>Got 5 errors
  2. Making distanceTo(player other) a public int >>Got 100 errors

Read full topic
item.source: Help with coding? Should be easy
